snippet.textDisplay:
Somehow female singing voices rarely fail to captivate me.  First Really Wild Animals, and now this.

And coincidentally enough, I wanted to become an MGS fan by the end of this year, and that series is from the same director.  Wowzers.
snippet.textOriginal:
Somehow female singing voices rarely fail to captivate me.  First Really Wild Animals, and now this.

And coincidentally enough, I wanted to become an MGS fan by the end of this year, and that series is from the same director.  Wowzers.

snippet.textDisplay:
(part 3)
Reaching out to catch the sun 
To hold it in our hands 
Longing for something strong to hide our weakness 
Soon the light may disappear 
Nothing is meant to last 
Yet we believe our world 
Searching for happiness 
The blue bird flies away
snippet.textOriginal:
(part 3)
Reaching out to catch the sun 
To hold it in our hands 
Longing for something strong to hide our weakness 
Soon the light may disappear 
Nothing is meant to last 
Yet we believe our world 
Searching for happiness 
The blue bird flies away

snippet.textDisplay:
(part 2)
Travelling beyond the bounds 
We have to take that step 
What are we waiting for? It's now or never 
Fear to see "The World to Be" 
Is why we hesitate 
Repeat the same mistake 
Hoping to break new ground 
The blue bird flies away
snippet.textOriginal:
(part 2)
Travelling beyond the bounds 
We have to take that step 
What are we waiting for? It's now or never 
Fear to see "The World to Be" 
Is why we hesitate 
Repeat the same mistake 
Hoping to break new ground 
The blue bird flies away

snippet.textDisplay:
(part 1)
Message of the blowing wind 
Erasing memories 
Stars are the witnesses of our existence 
Change is what the world awaits 
Could that be peace or war? 
The answer no one knows 
Trusting the break of dawn 
The blue bird flies away
snippet.textOriginal:
(part 1)
Message of the blowing wind 
Erasing memories 
Stars are the witnesses of our existence 
Change is what the world awaits 
Could that be peace or war? 
The answer no one knows 
Trusting the break of dawn 
The blue bird flies away

snippet.textDisplay:
I love this game! It had a rather incredible soundtrack all around.

For some reason the part that sticks out to me is when you have the girl (I do not recall the name) in Jehuty and you're headed to the lab. Dingo's doing his normal thing blowing up enemies and yelling out his battle cries, and the girl goes "Would you stop screaming in my ear?". I lol'd.
snippet.textOriginal:
